docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
ambr-py is an async API wrapper for Project Ambr written in Python. Project Ambr is a beautiful website that displays Genshin Impact game data. Developing something for Hoyoverse games? You might be interested in other API wrappers written by me.

Note: I am not the developer of Project Ambr.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Fully typed.
  • Fully asynchronous by using aiofiles, aiohttp, and asyncio, suitable for Discord bots.
  • Provides direct icon URLs.
  • Supports Python 3.11+.
  • Supports all game languages.
  • Supports persistent caching using SQLite.
  • Supports Pydantic V2, this also means full autocomplete support.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
# poetry
poetry add ambr-py

# pip
pip install ambr-py

docs.title: Quick Example
docs.text:
import ambr
import asyncio

async def main() -> None:
    async with ambr.AmbrAPI(ambr.Language.CHT) as client:
        await client.fetch_characters()

asyncio.run(main())

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Read the documentation to learn more about on how to use this wrapper.

docs.title: Questions, Issues, Feedback, Contributions
docs.text: Whether you want to make any bug reports, feature requests, or contribute to the wrapper, simply open an issue or pull request in this repository. If GitHub is not your type, you can find me on Discord, my username is @seria_ati.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
Every API call goes through the AmbrAPI class. You can see more details in the API Reference.

import ambr

async with ambr.AmbrAPI(ambr.Language.CHT) as api:
    characters = await api.fetch_characters()
    print(characters)

Overall, it's pretty straightforward. You can find all the available methods in the API Reference.

docs.title: Starting and Closing the Client Properly
docs.text:
Remember to call start() and close() or use async with to ensure proper connection management.

import ambr

async with ambr.AmbrAPI() as api:
    ...

# OR
api = ambr.AmbrAPI()
await api.start()
...
await api.close()

docs.title: Finding Model Attributes
docs.text: Refer to the Models section for a list of all available models and their attributes.

docs.title: Catching Errors
docs.text:
Refer to the Exceptions section for a list of all available exceptions, catch them with try/except blocks.

import ambr

async with ambr.AmbrAPI() as api:
    try:
        await api.fetch_character(0)
    except ambr.exceptions.DataNotFoundError:
        print("Character does not exist.")

docs.title: client
docs.text:
Classes:

  • AmbrAPI –

    Asynchronous client for interacting with the Ambr project API (gi.yatta.moe).

docs.title: AmbrAPI
docs.text:
Asynchronous client for interacting with the Ambr project API (gi.yatta.moe).

Provides methods to fetch various Genshin Impact game data.

Parameters:

Attributes:

  • lang –

    The language used for API requests.

  • BASE_URL (Final[str]) –

    The base URL for the Ambr API v2.

Methods:

  • close –

    Closes the internal aiohttp client session.

  • fetch_abyss_data –

    Fetches data for the current and potentially previous Spiral Abyss cycles.

  • fetch_achievement_categories –

    Fetches all achievement categories.

  • fetch_artifact_set_detail –

    Fetches detailed information for a specific artifact set by its ID.

  • fetch_artifact_sets –

    Fetches summary information for all artifact sets.

  • fetch_avatar_curve –

    Fetches the character stat growth curves.

  • fetch_book_detail –

    Fetches detailed information for a specific book by its ID, including volumes.

  • fetch_books –

    Fetches summary information for all readable books.

  • fetch_changelogs –

    Fetches the API changelogs.

  • fetch_character_detail –

    Fetches detailed information for a specific character by their ID.

  • fetch_character_fetter –

    Fetches character stories and voice-over quotes (fetter information) by character ID.

  • fetch_character_guide –

    Fetches community-sourced build guides for a specific character.

  • fetch_characters –

    Fetches summary information for all characters.

  • fetch_domains –

    Fetches information about daily domains and their rewards for each day of the week.

  • fetch_food_detail –

    Fetches detailed information for a specific food item by its ID.

  • fetch_foods –

    Fetches summary information for all food items.

  • fetch_furniture_detail –

    Fetches detailed information for a specific furniture item by its ID.

  • fetch_furniture_set_detail –

    Fetches detailed information for a specific furniture set by its ID.

  • fetch_furniture_sets –

    Fetches summary information for all furniture sets (Serenitea Pot).

  • fetch_furnitures –

    Fetches summary information for all furniture items (Serenitea Pot).

  • fetch_latest_version –

    Fetches the latest data version hash from the API.

  • fetch_manual_weapon –

    Fetches manual weapon data (purpose unclear from API structure).

  • fetch_material_detail –

    Fetches detailed information for a specific material by its ID.

  • fetch_materials –

    Fetches summary information for all materials (includes ingredients, ascension items, etc.).

  • fetch_monster_curve –

    Fetches the monster stat growth curves.

  • fetch_monster_detail –

    Fetches detailed information for a specific monster or living being by its ID.

  • fetch_monsters –

    Fetches summary information for all monsters and living beings.

  • fetch_namecard_detail –

    Fetches detailed information for a specific namecard by its ID.

  • fetch_namecards –

    Fetches summary information for all namecards.

  • fetch_quests –

    Fetches summary information for all quests.

  • fetch_readable –

    Fetches the text content of a specific readable item (like a book volume) by its ID.

  • fetch_tcg_card_detail –

    Fetches detailed information for a specific TCG card by its ID.

  • fetch_tcg_cards –

    Fetches summary information for all Genius Invokation TCG cards.

  • fetch_upgrade_data –

    Fetches general upgrade material requirements for characters and weapons.

  • fetch_weapon_curve –

    Fetches the weapon stat growth curves.

  • fetch_weapon_detail –

    Fetches detailed information for a specific weapon by its ID.

  • fetch_weapon_types –

    Fetches a mapping of weapon type identifiers to their display names.

  • fetch_weapons –

    Fetches summary information for all weapons.

  • start –

    Initializes the internal aiohttp client session.

docs.title: lang
docs.text:
(Language, default: EN ) –

The language for the API responses. Defaults to English (EN).

docs.title: cache_ttl
docs.text:
(int, default: 3600 ) –

Time-to-live for cached responses in seconds. Defaults to 3600 (1 hour).

docs.title: headers
docs.text:
(dict[str, Any] | None, default: None ) –

Optional custom headers for HTTP requests.

docs.title: session
docs.text:
(ClientSession | None, default: None ) –

Optional existing aiohttp.ClientSession to use. If None, a new CachedSession is created.

docs.title: close async
docs.text:
close() -> None

Closes the internal aiohttp client session.

Should be called to gracefully shut down the session if not using the client as an async context manager.

docs.title: fetch_abyss_data async
docs.text:
fetch_abyss_data(use_cache: bool = True) -> AbyssResponse

Fetches data for the current and potentially previous Spiral Abyss cycles.

Parameters:

Returns:

  • AbyssResponse –

    An AbyssResponse object containing details about abyss cycles, floors, enemies, etc.

Raises:

  • DataNotFoundError –

    If the requested data is not found (404).

  • ConnectionTimeoutError –

    If the connection times out (522, 524).

  • AmbrAPIError –

    For other API-related errors.

docs.title: use_cache
docs.text:
(bool, default: True ) –

Whether to use cached data if available. Defaults to True.

docs.title: start async
docs.text:
start() -> None

Initializes the internal aiohttp client session.

Must be called before making any API requests if not using the client as an async context manager. Creates a CachedSession if no session was provided during initialization.

docs.title: utils
docs.text:
Functions:

  • calculate_upgrade_stat_values –

    Calculates the stat values for a character or weapon at a specific level and ascension status.

  • format_layout –

    Extracts and replaces layout placeholders like {LAYOUT_MOBILE#Character Skill}.

  • format_num –

    Formats a number to a specified number of decimal places.

  • format_stat_values –

    Formats calculated stat values into strings, adding '%' for percentage stats.

  • get_params –

    Replaces parameter placeholders in text with formatted values from a list.

  • get_skill_attributes –

    Generates a formatted string of skill attributes from descriptions and parameters.

  • remove_html_tags –

    Removes HTML tags, sprite presets, and link tags from a string.

  • replace_fight_prop_with_name –

    Replaces fight property IDs (e.g., FIGHT_PROP_HP) with their human-readable names.

  • replace_placeholders –

    Replaces placeholders in a string with values from a dictionary.

  • replace_pronouns –

    Replaces gendered pronouns in the format {F#She}/{M#He} with She/He.

docs.title: get_params
docs.text:
get_params(text: str, param_list: list[int | float]) -> list[str]

Replaces parameter placeholders in text with formatted values from a list.

Placeholders are in the format {param:}, e.g., {param1:F1P}. Formats include: F1P, F2P: Float multiplied by 100, formatted to 1 or 2 decimal places with '%'. F1, F2: Float formatted to 1 or 2 decimal places. P: Float multiplied by 100, formatted to 0 decimal places with '%'. I: Integer.

Parameters:

Returns:

  • list[str] –

    A list of strings, typically split by '|', after parameter replacement and formatting.

docs.title: param_list
docs.text:
(list[int | float]) –

A list of numerical parameter values.

docs.text:

Generates a formatted string of skill attributes from descriptions and parameters.

Each description is processed by get_params and expected to return a key-value pair separated by '|'.

Parameters:

Returns:

  • str –

    A newline-separated string of "key: value" pairs for the skill attributes.

docs.title: abyss
docs.text:
Classes:

  • Abyss –

    Represents a full Spiral Abyss cycle configuration.

  • AbyssData –

    Represents data for either the Abyss Corridor or the Abyssal Moon Spire.

  • AbyssEnemy –

    Represents an enemy that can appear in the Spiral Abyss.

  • AbyssEnemyProperty –

    Represents a base property of an enemy found in the Spiral Abyss.

  • AbyssResponse –

    Represents the complete response for Spiral Abyss data.

  • Blessing –

    Represents the Benediction of the Abyssal Moon (Blessing) for a Spiral Abyss cycle.

  • ChallengeTarget –

    Represents the challenge targets for a Spiral Abyss chamber (e.g., time limits).

  • Chamber –

    Represents a single chamber within a Spiral Abyss floor.

  • Floor –

    Represents a floor within the Spiral Abyss (either Corridor or Spire).

  • LeyLineDisorder –

    Represents a Ley Line Disorder effect active on a Spiral Abyss floor.

docs.title: Abyss pydantic-model
docs.text:
Represents a full Spiral Abyss cycle configuration.

Attributes:

  • id (int) –

    The unique ID identifying this Spiral Abyss cycle.

  • open_time (datetime) –

    The start date and time of this cycle.

  • close_time (datetime) –

    The end date and time of this cycle.

  • blessing (Blessing) –

    The Benediction of the Abyssal Moon active during this cycle.

  • abyss_corridor (AbyssData) –

    Data for the Abyss Corridor floors (usually 1-8).

  • abyssal_moon_spire (AbyssData) –

    Data for the Abyssal Moon Spire floors (usually 9-12).

Fields:

  • id (int)
  • open_time (datetime)
  • close_time (datetime)
  • blessing (Blessing)
  • abyss_corridor (AbyssData)
  • abyssal_moon_spire (AbyssData)

Validators:

  • _format_open_time → open_time
  • _format_close_time → close_time
  • _format_blessing → blessing

docs.title: guides
docs.text:
Classes:

  • AvailableItems –

    Container for available characters, weapons, and artifacts referenced in guides.

  • AzaBestArtifact –

    Represents an artifact piece within a best artifact set from genshin.aza.gg.

  • AzaBestArtifactSets –

    Represents a ranked artifact set combination from genshin.aza.gg.

  • AzaBestItem –

    Represents a best-ranked item (character or weapon) from genshin.aza.gg.

  • AzaData –

    Container for all genshin.aza.gg guide data for a character.

  • CharacterGuide –

    Represents the complete guide data for a character, combining multiple sources.

  • GWBuild –

    Represents a complete build recommendation from Genshin Wizard.

  • GWBuildInfo –

    Represents a specific piece of information within a Genshin Wizard build section.

  • GWBuildInfoNormalArtifact –

    Represents a standard artifact reference in a Genshin Wizard build.

  • GWData –

    Container for all Genshin Wizard guide data for a character.

  • GWPlaystyle –

    Represents playstyle information from Genshin Wizard.

  • GWSynergy –

    Represents synergy and team composition information from Genshin Wizard.

  • GWSynergyElementCharacter –

    Represents a character slot recommendation based on element in a Genshin Wizard synergy team.

  • GWSynergyFlexibleCharacter –

    Represents a flexible character slot in a Genshin Wizard synergy team.

  • GWSynergyInfo –

    Represents a piece of textual information related to Genshin Wizard synergies.

  • GWSynergyNormalCharacter –

    Represents a specific character recommendation in a Genshin Wizard synergy team.

  • GuideArtifact –

    Represents an artifact within a guide context.

  • GuideCharacter –

    Represents a character within a guide context.

  • GuideWeapon –

    Represents a weapon within a guide context.

  • GwBuildInfoCustomArtifact –

    Represents a custom artifact reference in a Genshin Wizard build.

docs.title: AvailableItems pydantic-model
docs.text:
Container for available characters, weapons, and artifacts referenced in guides.

Attributes:

    A dictionary mapping character IDs to GuideCharacter objects.

  • weapons (dict[str, GuideWeapon]) –

    A dictionary mapping weapon IDs to GuideWeapon objects.

  • artifacts (dict[str, GuideArtifact]) –

    A dictionary mapping artifact set IDs to GuideArtifact objects.

Fields:

  • characters (dict[str, GuideCharacter])
  • weapons (dict[str, GuideWeapon])
  • artifacts (dict[str, GuideArtifact])

Represents an artifact piece within a best artifact set from genshin.aza.gg.

Fields:

  • id (int)
  • num (int)

docs.title: AzaBestArtifactSets pydantic-model
docs.text:
Represents a ranked artifact set combination from genshin.aza.gg.

Attributes:

  • sets (list[AzaBestArtifact]) –

    A list describing the combination of artifact sets (AzaBestArtifact).

  • sets (list[AzaBestArtifact])
  • value (float)

Validators:

  • __transform_sets → sets

docs.title: percentage property
docs.text:
percentage: str

Formats the value as a percentage string (e.g., "72.1%").

docs.text:
Represents a best-ranked item (character or weapon) from genshin.aza.gg.

docs.title: percentage property
docs.text:
percentage: str

Formats the value as a percentage string (e.g., "85.3%").

docs.title: GWBuildInfo pydantic-model
docs.text:
Represents a specific piece of information within a Genshin Wizard build section.

Attributes:

  • inline (bool) –

    Whether the information should be displayed inline.

    The name or label for this piece of information (e.g., "Main Stats").

  • value (str | None) –

    The textual value associated with the name (optional).

  • weapons (dict[int, str] | None) –

    A dictionary mapping recommended weapon IDs to their names (optional).

  • artifacts (list[GWBuildInfoNormalArtifact | GwBuildInfoCustomArtifact] | None) –

    A list of recommended artifact sets (normal or custom) (optional).

Fields:

  • inline (bool)
  • name (str)
  • value (str | None)
  • weapons (dict[int, str] | None)
  • artifacts (list[GWBuildInfoNormalArtifact | GwBuildInfoCustomArtifact] | None)

docs.title: weapons pydantic-field
docs.text:
weapons: dict[int, str] | None = None

Weapon ID to weapon name.

Classes:

    Represents a stat bonus gained from weapon promotion (ascension).

  • WeaponUpgrade –

    Represents the upgrade details (stats, promotions, awaken cost) of a weapon.
